definitions.definition: A piece of metal placed in a horse's mouth and connected to the reins to direct the animal.
definitions.example: A horse hates having a bit put in its mouth.

definitions.definition: A rotary cutting tool fitted to a drill, used to bore holes.
A coin of a specified value.
definitions.example: a threepenny bit

definitions.definition: A ten-cent piece, dime.
A unit of currency or coin in the Americas worth a fraction of a Spanish dollar; now specifically, an eighth of a US dollar.
definitions.example: A quarter is two bits.

definitions.definition: In the southern and southwestern states, a small silver coin (such as the real) formerly current; commonly, one worth about 12½ cents; also, the sum of 12½ cents.
A small amount of something.
definitions.example: There were bits of paper all over the floor.   Does your leg still hurt? / Just a bit now.   I've done my bit; I expect you to do yours.

definitions.definition: Specifically, a small amount of time.
definitions.example: I'll be there in a bit; I need to take care of something first.   He was here just a bit ago, but it looks like he's stepped out.

definitions.definition: (plural) Fractions of a second.
definitions.example: The 400 metres race was won in 47 seconds and bits.

definitions.definition: A portion of something.
definitions.example: I'd like a big bit of cake, please.

definitions.definition: Somewhat; something, but not very great; also used like jot and whit to express the smallest degree. See also a bit.
definitions.example: Am I bored? Not a bit of it!

definitions.definition: A prison sentence, especially a short one.
An excerpt of material making up part of a show, comedy routine, etc.
definitions.example: His bit about video games was not nearly as entertaining as the other segments of his show.

definitions.definition: A small part or role, sometimes with spoken lines, in a theatrical performance.
definitions.example: She acted her bit in the opening scene.

definitions.definition: The part of a key which enters the lock and acts upon the bolt and tumblers.
The cutting iron of a plane.
The bevelled front edge of an axehead along which the cutting edge runs.
To put a bridle upon; to put the bit in the mouth of (a horse).
Bitten.
definitions.example: Even though he's bit, of course the zombies would still chase him.

definitions.definition: (only in combination) Having been bitten.
To cut into something by clamping the teeth.
definitions.example: As soon as you bite that sandwich, you'll know how good it is.

definitions.definition: To hold something by clamping one's teeth.
To attack with the teeth.
definitions.example: That dog is about to bite!

definitions.definition: To behave aggressively; to reject advances.
definitions.example: If you see me, come and say hello. I don't bite.

definitions.definition: To take hold; to establish firm contact with.
definitions.example: I needed snow chains to make the tires bite.

definitions.definition: To have significant effect, often negative.
definitions.example: For homeowners with adjustable rate mortgages, rising interest will really bite.

definitions.definition: (of a fish) To bite a baited hook or other lure and thus be caught.
definitions.example: Are the fish biting today?

definitions.definition: To accept something offered, often secretly or deceptively, to cause some action by the acceptor.
definitions.example: I've planted the story. Do you think they'll bite?

definitions.definition: (of an insect) To sting.
definitions.example: These mosquitoes are really biting today!

definitions.definition: To cause a smarting sensation; to have a property which causes such a sensation; to be pungent.
definitions.example: It bites like pepper or mustard.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) To cause sharp pain or damage to; to hurt or injure.
definitions.example: Pepper bites the mouth.

definitions.definition: To cause sharp pain; to produce anguish; to hurt or injure; to have the property of so doing.
To take or keep a firm hold.
definitions.example: The anchor bites.

definitions.definition: To take hold of; to hold fast; to adhere to.
definitions.example: The anchor bites the ground.

definitions.definition: To lack quality; to be worthy of derision; to suck.
definitions.example: This music really bites.

definitions.definition: To perform oral sex on. Used in invective.
definitions.example: You don't like that I sat on your car? Bite me.

definitions.definition: To plagiarize, to imitate.
definitions.example: He always be biting my moves.

definitions.definition: To deceive or defraud; to take in.
A binary digit, generally represented as a 1 or 0.
The smallest unit of storage in a digital computer, consisting of a binary digit.
Any datum that may take on one of exactly two values.
definitions.example: permission bits in a file system

definitions.definition: A unit of measure for information entropy.
A microbitcoin, or a millionth of a bitcoin (0.000001 BTC).
